meanings.definition: A gripping tool with two hinged arms used for gripping and pulling
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith used the pincers to hold the hot metal securely.
meanings.sent2: She reached for the pincers to grab the stubborn nail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the pincers, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pincers, gripping her heart tightly.
meanings.sent5: The pincers clamped down on the rusty bolt, refusing to let go.

meanings.definition: A pair of pointed instruments used for holding small objects or for bending and cutting wire
meanings.sent1: The jeweler carefully used the pincers to set the tiny gemstone.
meanings.sent2: He always kept a pair of pincers in his toolbox for delicate tasks.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly grabbed the pincers instead of the tongs to pick up the cherry.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words acted like pincers, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The pincers delicately twisted the wire into a perfect coil.
